bboxes.raw_text:
CHICAGO Fifty-mile hikes,
the fading footsore fad of 1868,
should be rare exception rather
than the rule for visitors at the
1864 Worlds Fair in New York,
according to Greyhound officials.


Greyhound at the World S Fair,
Inc, will offer radio dispatched
travel service for on-the-spot
transportation. Included in the
company's fleet of more than
800 specially designed vehicles
will be "Glide-a-Rides." each
consisting of motorized unit and
three trailers carrying 90 per-
sons. and four-passenger "Es-
corter" lounge cars.

To insure that empty "Glide-
a-Rde" vehicles and Escort
err cars are matched up quickly
with energetic but foot-weary
fairgoers, Greyhound plans to
coordinate movement of the We
hicles through use of an extern
sive two-way radio system.
Equipment for the unique COM
munications network was recent
ly ordered from Motorola. In
cluded are dispatching facilities
for use at Greyhound exhibit
building at the Fair, and 20
lightweight portable radios which
will be assigned to rowing super
visors.

ANNAPOLIS, Md. Sixteen
demonstrators were arrested
Monday for refusing to leave
restaurant. Police had to drag
them away.


About 400 persons had marched
on the state capital protesting
police tactics during last week
racial disturbance at Princess
Anne when 3O0Negro college stu
dents fought with state troopers.


Those arrested we're charged
with disorderly conduct.

Governor Paul Fannin will be
the principal speaker during the
annual convention banquet of the
Arizona Association of Realtors,
Saturday evening, April 4. at
the Ramada Inn, Phoenix, accord
ing to Henry E. Brodersen. of
Phoenix, President Of the Asso-
citation.


The Realtor' 10Th Annual Con-
vention will be held at the Ramada
Inn. Friday and Saturday Of April
ga.

Gov. Funnin
To Speak To Realtors

CARPETS Unstable D and re-
paired Days, evenings Sundays
Cell. 275-3053. .... ...-.,.,.,.. ........

10 Arrested


In Maryland
full articles.article:
ANNAPOLIS, Md. Sixteen
demonstrators were arrested
Monday for refusing to leave
restaurant. Police had to drag
them away.


About 400 persons had marched
on the state capital protesting
police tactics during last week
racial disturbance at Princess
Anne when 3O0Negro college stu
dents fought with state troopers.


Those arrested we're charged
with disorderly conduct.
